byline.original: By SULIMAN ALI ZWAY and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

abstract: Local officials in Libya report that Islamic State has made further gains there, expanding its territory and driving out militia from city Misurata; Western officials are concerned by group's advances, given how close country is to Europe.
lead_paragraph: The group’s expansion in Libya gives it an alternative base of operations as it appears to be gaining ground in Palmyra in Syria and in Ramadi in Iraq.

headline.main: Western Officials Alarmed as ISIS Expands Territory in Libya
headline.print_headline: Western Officials Alarmed by ISIS’ Advances in Libya

snippet: The group’s expansion in Libya gives it an alternative base of operations as it appears to be gaining ground in Palmyra in Syria and in Ramadi in Iraq.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
